00029 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00030 /// CTreeGraphView::CTreeGraphView
00031 ///
00032 /// @description    This is the constructor of the CTreeGraphView class which is
00033 ///                 responsible for allowing users to interact with the graph
00034 ///                 portion of a tree.
00035 /// @pre            None
00036 /// @post           Member variables have been initialized.
00037 ///
00038 /// @param parent:  This is a pointer to the parent QObject.
00039 ///
00040 /// @limitations    None
00041 ///
00042 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00043 CTreeGraphView::CTreeGraphView( QWidget *parent )
00044 : QScrollArea( parent )
00045 {
00046     //Initialize the canvas.
00047     setupCanvas();
00048     setWidget( m_canvas );
00049     m_canvas->setMouseTracking( true );
00050     m_canvas->setFocusPolicy(Qt::StrongFocus);
00051 
00052     //Create the model, node artist, and editors.
00053     m_model = new CTreeGraphModel( this );
00054 
00055     m_historyArtist = new CTreeHistoryArtist( m_canvas );
00056     m_historyArtist->setModel( m_model );
00057 
00058     m_nodeArtist = new CTreeNodeArtist( m_canvas );
00059     m_nodeArtist->setModel( m_model );
00060 
00061     m_nodeMover = new CTreeNodeMover( m_canvas );
00062     m_nodeMover->setModel( m_model );
00063 
00064     m_nodeEditor = new CTreeNodeEditor( m_canvas );
00065     m_nodeEditor->setModel( m_model );
00066     m_nodeEditor->setArtist( m_nodeArtist );
00067 
00068     m_nodeQuickEditor = new CTreeNodeQuickEditor( m_canvas );
00069     m_nodeQuickEditor->setModel( m_model );
00070     m_quickEdit = false;
00071 
00072     connect( m_model, SIGNAL(repaint()), this, SLOT(modelChanged()) );
00073     connect( m_model, SIGNAL(quickEditOff()), this, SLOT(setQuickEditOff()));
00074     connect( m_nodeMover, SIGNAL(done()), this, SLOT(moveDone()) );
00075 }

00079 ///
00080 /// @description  This is the destructor for the CTreeGraphView class which
00081 ///               frees up dynamically allocated memory.
00082 /// @pre          None
00083 /// @post         None
00084 ///
00085 /// @limitations  None
00086 ///
00087 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00088 CTreeGraphView::~CTreeGraphView()
00089 {
00090     if ( m_nodeArtist )
00091         delete m_nodeArtist;
00092 }

00124 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00125 /// CTreeGraphView::autoNumber
00126 ///
00127 /// @description  This function prompts the user for a minimum and maximum
00128 ///               integer to use when randomly generating node values for the
00129 ///               graph.
00130 /// @pre          None
00131 /// @post         If a valid number range is given, all nodes are given a
00132 ///               randomly generated value within the range.
00133 ///
00134 /// @limitations  None
00135 ///
00136 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00137 void CTreeGraphView::autoNumber()
00138 {
00139     bool ok;
00140 
00141     //Prompt the user for a minimum value.
00142     int min = QInputDialog::getInteger( parentWidget(), tr("Minimum Value"),
00143                   tr("Enter minimum value"), 0, (int)MIN_FLOAT_VAL,
00144                   (int)MAX_FLOAT_VAL, 1, &ok );
00145 
00146     //Check if the user clicked cancel and return if they did.
00147     if ( !ok )
00148         return;
00149 
00150     //Prompt the user for a maximum value.
00151     int max = QInputDialog::getInteger( parentWidget(), tr("Maximum Value"),
00152                   tr("Enter maximum value"), 0, (int)MIN_FLOAT_VAL,
00153                   (int)MAX_FLOAT_VAL, 1, &ok );
00154 
00155     //Check if the user clicked ok instead of cancel.
00156     if ( ok )
00157         //Check if the range was valid and randomly generate numbers for the
00158         //graph nodes.
00159         if ( min < max )
00160             m_model->autoNumber( min, max );
00161         //Otherwise, warn the user the range wasn't valid.
00162         else
00163             QMessageBox::critical( NULL, tr("Error!"), tr("Max value must be "
00164                                    "greater than min value."),
00165                                    QMessageBox::Ok, QMessageBox::NoButton );
00166 }
00167 
00168 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00169 /// CTreeGraphView::generateTree
00170 ///
00171 /// @description  This function prompts the user for a depth, a minimum and maximum
00172 ///               branching factor, and a quiescent percentage. The current tree is
00173 ///               then replaced by a random tree matching that description.
00174 /// @pre          None
00175 /// @post         Tree is replaced by a random tree
00176 ///
00177 /// @limitations  Tree will stop being generated at 702 nodes, because the
00178 ///               naming convention can accomodate no more.
00179 ///
00180 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00181 void CTreeGraphView::generateTree()
00182 {
00183     // Declaring these static will make the dialogs default to the value most
00184     // recently entered.
00185     static int depth = 4;
00186     static int minBranch = 1;
00187     static int maxBranch = 4;
00188     static int qp = 0;
00189     bool ok;
00190     depth = QInputDialog::getInteger( parentWidget(),
00191                     tr("Depth"), // Title
00192                     tr("Enter depth"), // Label
00193                     depth, // Value
00194                     0, // MinValue
00195                     20, // MaxValue
00196                     1, // Step
00197                     &ok ); // Ok
00198 
00199     if(!ok) return;
00200 
00201     minBranch = QInputDialog::getInteger( parentWidget(),
00202                     tr("Branching Factor"), // Title
00203                     tr("Enter MIN branching factor"), // Label
00204                     minBranch, // Value
00205                     1, // MinValue
00206                     8, // MaxValue
00207                     1, // Step
00208                     &ok ); // Ok
00209 
00210     if(!ok) return;
00211 
00212     maxBranch = QInputDialog::getInteger( parentWidget(),
00213                     tr("Branching Factor"), // Title
00214                     tr("Enter MAX branching factor"), // Label
00215                     maxBranch, // Value
00216                     minBranch, // MinValue
00217                     8, // MaxValue
00218                     1, // Step
00219                     &ok ); // Ok
00220 
00221     if(!ok) return;
00222 
00223 
00224     qp = QInputDialog::getInteger( parentWidget(),
00225                     tr("Quiescent Percentage"), // Title
00226                     tr("Enter Quiescent Percentage"), // Label
00227                     qp, // Value
00228                     0, // MinValue
00229                     100, // MaxValue
00230                     1, // Step
00231                     &ok ); // Ok
00232 
00233     if(!ok) return;
00234     m_model->createNewData();
00235     int treeSize = 1;
00236     generateSubTree( m_model->getRootNode(), depth, minBranch, maxBranch, qp, treeSize );
00237 
00238     autoLayout();
00239     autoName();
00240 
00241 }
00242 
00243 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00244 /// CTreeGraphView::generateSubTree
00245 ///
00246 /// @description  Helper for generateTree(). Generates a subtree with given node
00247 ///               as the root.
00248 /// @pre          root must point to a node.
00249 /// @post         Random subtree with given features is created, treeSize is increased
00250 ///               appropriately.
00251 ///
00252 /// @param root:      Pointer to the beginning of the new subtree.
00253 /// @param depth:     Desired depth of the subtree.
00254 /// @param minBranch: Minimum branching factor.
00255 /// @param maxBranch: Maximum branching factor.
00256 /// @param qp:        quiescent percentage.
00257 /// @param treeSize:  Current treesize. This will be incremented as subtree grows, and
00258 ///                   process will halt prematurely if it reaches 702.
00259 /// @return bool: True if tree was completed. False if not.               
00260 ///
00261 /// @limitations  None
00262 ///
00263 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00264 bool CTreeGraphView::generateSubTree( STreeNode * root, int depth, 
00265                                       int minBranch, int maxBranch, int qp, int &treeSize)
00266 {
00267     if(depth > 0)
00268     {
00269         int branch = minBranch + ( rand() % (maxBranch - minBranch + 1) );
00270         for(int i=0; i<branch; i++)
00271         {
00272             STreeNode *child = m_model->addChildNodeBasic(root);
00273             treeSize++;
00274             if(treeSize >= 702)
00275             {
00276                 QMessageBox::information(this, "GNAT",
00277                     "Node limit reached.\n"
00278                     "Tree generation terminated.");
00279                 return false;
00280             }
00281             if((rand() % 100) < qp)
00282                 child -> s_quiescent = true;
00283             if(!generateSubTree( child, depth-1, minBranch, maxBranch, qp, treeSize ))
00284                 return false;
00285         }
00286     }
00287     return true;
00288 }
00289 
00290 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00291 /// CTreeGraphView::eventFilter
00292 ///
00293 /// @description   This function filters events so they get passed on to the
00294 ///                appropriate child object.
00295 /// @pre           None
00296 /// @post          None
00297 ///
00298 /// @param o:      This is a pointer to the QObject where the event was
00299 ///                triggered from.
00300 /// @param e:      This is a pointer to the QEvent that was triggered.
00301 ///
00302 /// @return bool:  Returns true if the event was used and false otherwise.
00303 ///
00304 /// @limitations   None
00305 ///
00306 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00307 bool CTreeGraphView::eventFilter( QObject *o, QEvent *e )
00308 {
00309     bool bReturn;
00310 
00311     //Make sure the object where the event was triggered is the canvas.
00312     if( o == m_canvas )
00313     {
00314         switch( e->type() )
00315         {
00316         case QEvent::Paint:
00317             //Call the paint function in the node editor to paint any new
00318             //nodes or subtrees being moved.
00319             m_nodeEditor->paint();
00320 
00321             //Paint the model
00322             m_nodeArtist->paintModel();
00323             
00324             //Paint the History Table
00325             m_historyArtist->paintTable();
00326             return true;
00327 
00328         case QEvent::MouseButtonPress:
00329         case QEvent::MouseButtonRelease:
00330         case QEvent::MouseMove:
00331             //Pass the event first to the node editor.
00332             bReturn = m_nodeEditor->canvasMouseEvent(
00333                           static_cast<QMouseEvent *>(e) );
00334 
00335             //If the node editor didn't use the event, let the node mover have
00336             //it.
00337             if ( !bReturn )
00338                 bReturn = m_nodeMover->canvasMouseEvent(
00339                               static_cast<QMouseEvent *>(e) );
00340 
00341             //If the node mover didn't use the event and quick edit is turned
00342             //on, pass the event to the node quick editor.
00343             if ( !bReturn && m_quickEdit )
00344                 bReturn = m_nodeQuickEditor->canvasMouseEvent(
00345                               static_cast<QMouseEvent *>(e) );
00346             return bReturn;
00347 
00348         case QEvent::ContextMenu:
00349             //Pass the context menu event to the node editor.
00350             return m_nodeEditor->canvasContextEvent(
00351                        static_cast<QContextMenuEvent *>(e) );
00352 
00353         case QEvent::KeyPress:
00354             //If quick edit is turned on, pass keypress events to the node
00355             //quick editor.
00356             if( m_quickEdit )
00357                 return m_nodeQuickEditor->canvasKeyPressEvent(
00358                        static_cast<QKeyEvent *>(e) );
00359         default:
00360             break;
00361         }
00362     }
00363 
00364     //Pass the event to the QScrollArea.
00365     return QScrollArea::eventFilter(o,e);
00366 }

00418 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00419 /// CTreeGraphView::moveDone
00420 ///
00421 /// @description  This function is used as a slot to indicate a node is done
00422 ///               being moved.  It makes sure that the graph is fully shown on
00423 ///               the screen.

00426 ///
00427 /// @limitations  None

00430 void CTreeGraphView::moveDone()

00433     updateCanvasSize();

00455 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00456 /// CTreeGraphView::saveImage
00457 ///
00458 /// @description      This function saves the current graph image as a PNG file.
00459 /// @pre              None
00460 /// @post             The graph image has been saved to the given PNG file name.
00461 ///
00462 /// @param fileName:  This is the name of the file to save the graph image to.
00463 ///
00464 /// @limitations      None
00465 ///
00466 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00467 void CTreeGraphView::saveImage( const QString &fileName )
00468 {
00469     //Get the containing rect of the graph to properly size the image.
00470     QRect rect = m_model->getContainingRect();
00471 
00472     //Create the pixmap to properly fit the image.
00473     QPixmap image( rect.size() );
00474 
00475     //Check transparent or white.
00476     int choice = QMessageBox::question( this,
00477         "Select Background Color",
00478         "Select prefered background color",
00479         "Transparent",
00480         "White");
00481     
00482     QColor background(255,255,255,0);
00483     if( choice == 1 )
00484         background.setAlpha(255);
00485         
00486 
00487     //Make the background of the image white.
00488     image.fill(background);
00489     QPainter painter( &image );
00490 
00491     //Translate the painter so all excess white space on the graph is removed.
00492     painter.translate( -( rect.topLeft() ) );
00493     m_nodeArtist->paintModel( &painter );
00494 
00495     //Save the image.
00496     image.save( fileName, "PNG" );
00497 }

00554 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00555 /// CTreeGraphView::setupCanvas
00556 ///
00557 /// @description  This function creates the canvas and prepares it to be drawn
00558 ///               on.

00560 /// @post         The canvas is ready to be drawn to.

00564 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00565 void CTreeGraphView::setupCanvas()
00566 {
00567     m_canvas = new QWidget;
00568 
00569     QPalette pal(m_canvas->palette());
00570     pal.setColor( QPalette::Active, QPalette::Background, Qt::white );
00571     m_canvas->setPalette(pal);
00572 }

00574 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00575 /// CTreeGraphView::updateCanvasSize
00576 ///
00577 /// @description  This function resizes the canvas if a node is dragged off the
00578 ///               canvas screen so that scroll bars appear and the node can
00579 ///               be viewed still.
00580 /// @pre          None
00581 /// @post         The canvas is resized to the smallest size which fits the
00582 ///               window and allows all nodes to still be seen.
00583 ///
00584 /// @limitations  None
00585 ///
00586 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00587 void CTreeGraphView::updateCanvasSize()
00588 {
00589     QRect minCanvasRect( m_model->getContainingRect() );
00590     minCanvasRect.setTopLeft( QPoint(0,0) );
00591 
00592     m_canvas->resize( minCanvasRect.size().expandedTo( viewport()->size() ) );
00593 }
